data.title: US approves $385 million arms sale to Taiwan
data.description: WASHINGTON — The United States State Department has approved the potential sale of spare parts for F-16 jets and radars to Taiwan for an estimated US$385 million, the Pentagon said on Friday, a day before Taiwan President Lai Ching-te starts a sensitive Pacific trip.

data.title: Floodwaters recede in Hat Yai's economic areas
data.description: SONGKHLA — Floodwaters have begun to recede in the economic zones of Hat Yai, while other parts of the tourist district remain inundated.

data.title: Thailand gears up for petroleum exploration in Andaman Sea
data.description: Government looks to tap alternative resources as talks with Cambodia yet to take off

data.title: Drone Tech Asia 2024 Showcases Cutting-Edge UAV Innovations
data.description: More than 60 leading companies from the sector took part, presenting more than 100 brands

data.title: German tourist suffers severe injury after being bitten while swimming
data.description: Local authorities in Khao Lak don’t rule out shark attack

data.title: Cold snap ends, heavy rains continue to batter Southern Thailand
data.description: Upper Thailand expected to see warmer temperatures

data.title: Government pulls off a narrow victory at THAI creditors’ meeting
data.description: Secures narrow backing for adding two state officials as rehabilitation plan administrators

data.title: Body of sixth victim in deadly Rama II Road crane collapse retrieved
data.description: Transport Minister Suriya expected to visit accident site today

data.title: Old places, new menus
data.description: Bored of eating the same thing twice? Fear no more, here

data.title: ONE Championship hopeful Yunusov thanks Anatoly Malykhin after KO and bonus in Bangkok
data.description: Rustam Yunusov has thanked Anatoly Malykhin and the two-division ONE Championship MMA champ’s wife after another big victory in Bangkok.

data.title: ONE Championship ‘honoured’ by Eliud Kipchoge’s presence for Friday Fights 89 at Lumpinee Stadium
data.description: Marathon legend Eliud Kipchoge was the star guest for another action-packed night full of knockouts and bonuses at ONE Friday Fights 89 in Bangkok.

data.title: Bangkok postpones plan to close major road
data.description: The Bangkok Metropolitan Administration (BMA) has postponed plans to close the elevated road on Rama IX from Dec 2 this year until further notice.

data.title: Nation Foundation offers assistance to South flood victims
data.description: The "Nation Shares Compassion to Aid Flood Victims" initiative, organised by the Nation Foundation in collaboration with southern community aid networks and private sector partners, aims to support those affected by the recent flooding.

data.title: 14 charter change bills set for debate on House return
data.description: A total of 14 bills partially amending the 2017 constitution are set to be deliberated when the House reconvenes next month, Speaker Wan Muhamad Noor Matha said on Friday.

data.description: The prospect of the next polls in 2027 being run under the current constitution shouldn

data.title: 14 charter change bills set for debate on House return
data.description: A total of 14 bills partially amending the 2017 constitution are set to be deliberated when the House reconvenes next month, the speaker Wan Muhamad Noor Matha said yesterday.

data.title: ONE Championship’s new grappling star Dante Leon feels ‘no pressure to fill Mikey Musumeci void’
data.description: ONE Championship’s latest grappling star signing Dante Leon insists he feels “no pressure to fill a void left by Mikey Musumeci”.

data.title: Explainer: How govt plans to fund the THB20 flat train fare
data.description: Around THB16 billion required to expand the rate to all train routes from September 2025

data.title: ONE Championship: Nabil says kickboxing is ‘easier than Muay Thai’, plans ‘something special’ for Petchtanong
data.description: Nabil Anane admits he is the underdog against “master” Petchtanong Petchfergus at ONE Fight Night 26 next week in Bangkok – but feels kickboxing is “easier than Muay Thai”, and warns the former champ he has “something special” planned.

data.title: Syrian rebels breach city of Aleppo, in biggest advance in years
data.description: ALEPPO — Syrian rebels breached the major city of Aleppo on Friday, according to the fighters and a war monitor, raising fears that the nation

data.title: Five booming businesses driving Phuket’s land prices sky high
data.description: Developer Sansiri plans to invest 25 billion baht in 27 new projects in the next five years

data.title: MRC Council reaffirms commitment to regional cooperation
data.description: The Mekong River Commission's policy-making body met today in Luang Prabang to review progress, address the growing challenges facing the Mekong River Basin, and re-commit to regional cooperation.

data.title: Notre Dame Cathedral unveils its new interior 5 years after devastating fire
data.description: PARIS (AP) — After more than five years of frenetic, but sometimes interrupted, reconstruction work, Notre Dame Cathedral showed itself anew to the world Friday, with rebuilt soaring ceilings and creamy good-as-new stonework erasing somber memories of its devastating fire in 2019.

data.title: Cabinet approves THB641 million for post-flood rehabilitation in North
data.description: The Cabinet on Friday approved 641.13 million baht for flood rehabilitation projects in Chiang Mai and Chiang Rai provinces in a bid to boost the confidence of travellers during the high tourism season.

data.title: Agoda, Thai Government unite to inspire Thailand's future tech leaders
data.description: Agoda partners with MHESI to upskill Thai students and teach them real-world tech applications in a corporate setting. The initiative aims to inspire further studies and careers in tech, fostering innovation and future leadership across Thailand.
